critique: This document is an executive order from 1938 that withdraws public land in California for the exclusive use of the Navy Department. It does not express a clear ideological tilt. It has no implications for immigration. It could be argued that reserving land for the Navy expands executive power, but it is also done under the authority of existing legislation, so I will mark it as neutral. It centralizes control of land in the federal government, so it leans towards federal primacy. It prioritizes national security by reserving land for the Navy. It does not directly regulate the economy. It does not address social inclusion.
